noun.description: The process of using one's mind to consider or reason about something.
examples: they have done some thinking about welfare reform

adjective.description: Using thought or rational judgment; intelligent.
examples: he seemed to be a thinking man

phrases: However, his great stroke of genius was the lateral thinking he employed when he decided to use the same principle on a larger scale, on a different surface, thus inventing the lawn mower. Good thinking, huh?
That was good thinking, Doc - I wish I could go to sleep in three seconds all the time!

The first thing to remember is that while allowing employees to have some fun is good thinking, everyone needs to remember that they call it work for a reason - it's work, not play, despite the great weather.
And Rick, good thinking with the coffee!
Now that's good thinking, but still not very heroic.
